titleStmt.title: record of entry among the ephebi
titleStmt.author: unknown

msContents.summary: This document provides the proof that Diogenes had indeed been enrolled into the epheboi, namely the tribe Sosikosmios and the deme Athaieus. The docket on the verso strongly suggests that the certificate on the recto was requested by their son Julius to prove his own eligibility to this privileged class within the Alexandrian and Egyptian society.

msItemStruct.note: cited by editor as Lot III, no. 132.

condition.ab: This medium-brown papyrus is broken horizontally above and below the middle of the papyrus, leaving three almost equally sized fragments. The text is complete at the top, at the bottom, and to the right; the left margin has been lost, but the numbers of letters lost per line is minimal and may not have exceeded five. (TC)

handDesc.p: The text is written in a medium-sized and somewhat irregular cursive hand. The letters are mostly unconnected. At the top a blank space of 3.3 cm. has been left free, and at the bottom a blank space of 4.6 cm. The end of the text on the recto is marked by a horizontal stroke stretching across the entire width of the papyrus sheet. The letter zeta is placed well below this horizontal stroke. This letter is in a larger hand than the text and of a somewhat different type, but not necessarily the work of a different scribe. The docket on the verso is also running parallel to the fibers. (TC)

div.ab: "The time of the entry to the ephebia in the 20th year of Imperator Caesar Titus Aelius Hadrianus Antoninus Pius Augustus, on the 23rd of the month Sebastos Eusebiou. Diogenes, son of Gaius, from the Sosikosmos tribe and the Althaieus deme, 37 years of age, and his wife Klematia, daughter of Philippos, of the city, 42 years of age in conjunction with her legal guardian, her brother Sarapion of the Sosikosmios tribe and . . . and the Althaieus deme, 32 years of age, from the Arsinoe Eleusinia street, who are with eachother without registration, their son is Julius at the age of one in the 11th year of Imperator Caesar Traianus Hadrianus Augustus Neos Sebastos on the third of Hadrianus, from the plagion of Ptolemaios, son of Ptolemaios alias Harpokration.";"7";(Verso): "Epheby of the father of Julius." (TC)
